title: Coding Labs
text:
Personal Portfolio
From this lab I learned how to use Quarto and build this website using Github.




Minnesota Tree Growth
In this lab, I learned how to use essential dplyr functions including filter, mutate, and rename.




COVID Wrangling
In the COVID wrangling lab I learned how to make a flextable.




LTER Network Data
In lab 4 I learned how to conduct statistical tests such as t.test or shapiro.test on a data set.




Final Project Proposals
In lab 5 I learned how to make a Quarto manuscript and use Quarto to create a citations page.




Machine Learning in Hydrology
In lab 6 I learned how to use workflows.




Project Kickoff
In lab 7 I expanded upon what was created in lab 5 for the course’s final project.




Machine Learning
In lab 8 I learned how to tune a model created with tidymodels.




Project Updates
In lab 9 I expanded upon what was created in lab 5 for the course’s final project.




Distance to The Border
In lab 10 I learned how to use sf_distance to calculate the distance between two places in an sf object.




Lightning Talk
For lab 11 my group mates and I gave a lightning talk to our lab section on urban population density vs access to open spaces.

title: Welcome
text: I am a 4th year student at Colorado State University studying Ecosystem Science and Sustainability, graduating with my Bachelors of Science in May 2026 and Professional Science Masters in May 2027. I am deeply committed to the conservation of the natural world, with a focus in addressing the challenges of climate change through collaborative, community-driven solutions. I am pursuing a career in environmental science because I want to make a positive, lasting impact on our planet.

title: GIS Portfolio
text:
World Travel
When given the opportunity to “choose my own geospatial adventure” in NR 493, Seminar on GIS and Remote Sensing Applications, I decided to fine tune my cartography skills and create a product that is both informational and visually appealing. I collected the data, years and places my grandmother has traveled, then joined it to a world countries polygons layer. I then used creative style packages and techniques from John Nelson, Esri cartographer, to create the following. I will be collecting feedback and improving this map Fall 2025.

title: Projects
text: Below is “Perceived Environmental Responsibility: How Undergraduate Students’ Educational and Social Background Influences Their Role in Addressing Sustainability Challenges”. This mixed methods research report was created for ESS 312, Sustainability Science.

title: Projects
text:
Qualitative Research
Below is “Perceived Environmental Responsibility: How Undergraduate Students’ Educational and Social Background Influences Their Role in Addressing Sustainability Challenges”. This mixed methods research report was created for ESS 312, Sustainability Science.

title: Projects
text:
Course Development
I have created content to two masters-level courses for a developing program in the Natural Resources Recreation and Tourism department at Colorado State University. Thank you to Dr. Stu Cottrell for the opportunity to contribute to this.



Science and Democracy
The following is a proposal created in CO 301B, Writing in the Sciences, to argue for the Way Cup initative created by Wolverine Farm Publick House to be implemented across all coffee shops in the City of Fort Collins.
